item.title: Java being weird
item.dc:creator: @Zombiedevice Zombiedevice
item.description:
@Zombiedevice wrote:

[quote=“Rayne, post:7, topic:217959”][quote author=Zombiedevice link=topic=286440.msg2318529#msg2318529 date=1215408705]

ok omg its nick thats the hard way here is the easy way
right click your compiler/client and click edit and delete everything and copy this

@echo off
COLOR 08
title Dannydude8 client
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
paus

Doesn’t matter what is in your compiler code if the class path isn’t even right.
[/quote]
thank you[/quote]

Oh I didn’t even know you posted that. I didn’t read the comments though.

item.title: Java being weird
item.dc:creator: @Rayne Rayne
item.description:
@Rayne wrote:

enviormental variables is easier, and if you do that[quote=“dannydude8, post:3, topic:217959”]ok omg its nick thats the hard way here is the easy way
right click your compiler/client and click edit and delete everything and copy this

@echo off
COLOR 08
title Dannydude8 client
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
paus[/quote]
how the hell is your computer gonna find java if you dont have paths to follow?

go to control panel > system > advanced > environmental variables
Make a user variable only!!!

CLASSPATH

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Make another user variable
PATH

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin

Read full topic
